{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3491648,"name":"","username":"Mariners","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/8dc957/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T15:59:36.902Z","cooked":"

I have been trying to run a SYSID analysis of our robot’s elevator. I ran all necessary tests (Dynamic and Quasistatic, both forward and reverse), and I’m getting this error:

image1489×933 159 KB

As you can see, the data selector has all the required tests, which is the only solution I’ve found while researching this problem.

These are the logs I attempted to analyse: SYSID Test.zip - Google Drive

I would really appreciate any help in this problem!
Thanks a lot!

Have you tried doing what the error message tells you to do? If so, what happened?

I received this error when testing a very fast, overpowered, simulated elevator. I didn’t try it, but on reflection it may be helpful to lower the voltage step for the dynamic test – that would make the test take longer and provide more sample points.

I’m having a bit of trouble understanding what the error message recommends. What does it mean “adjust the velocity threshold”? I am using a simulation elevator, but I don’t think it’s wildly inaccurate.

Look at the UI behind the error message. There’s a box labeled velocity threshold.

Other mentioned parameters are either on the UI as well, or in the test routine config.
